organism.organism_name: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Infantis

description.comment: Salmonella Infantis has become an increasingly prevalent Salmonella serotype in broiler chickens, and human infections caused by Salmonella. Specifically, the emergence of multi-drug resistant (MDR) extended-spectrum beta-lactamase (ESBL)-producing S. Infantis in humans, food animals, and retail chickens underscores a significant public health concern. This is the first report of S. Infantis harboring the pESI mega-plasmid isolated from a cat.
